content: this is the mg and in this video we're talking about undercoating ultra cheap
wargaming terrain
so if you enjoy these videos consider supporting me on my store the dmg dot in
forward slash store where you can help financially support this content if you
like this video button of course share it with your friends on all kinds of
social media or just directly via email or shove the laptop in front of them
okay you're gonna grab the cheapest black spray-paint that you can possibly
find it doesn't matter about the quality so long as it is acrylic spray paint and
we're just gonna hit all the rocky bits and the edges of the pizza boxes so it
doesn't matter if it gets a little bit on the top where there's no rocks that's
fine adds to the flavor any of the low-lying areas bits of rock whatever
anything that should be in shadow you're gonna hit it with this black matte black
spray paint of course if you've got some kind of paint sprayer or you've got a
car sprayer or something an airbrush that you can use of course go ahead use
that if you have it but don't go out and buy anything super expensive use the
cheapest you can possibly find so again it just hit all the rocks you want to
get every all around the rocks arm every single side so you're getting all the
areas that would be in shadow and all the deep recesses and all that kind of
stuff the grooves and everything else that could possibly be in shadow so
obviously there's going to be some left over and we're gonna paint a little bit
under those flaps but you don't need to paint directly underneath the flaps if
you don't want to so now we're going to grab a matte mid-tone grey so we're
gonna shake it up or all the spray paint cans we're gonna shake them up and just
do a test spray to make sure you're getting the right sort of flow and
you're just gonna dust the tops of the rocks
you don't want to get into the shadows you just want to sort of from an angle
from the top from each side so you've got as almost an omnidirectional light
just dust the top of all the rocks just the rocks we don't need any of the other
bits and pieces now I'm not doing it in the actual riverbed here just on the
rocks on the edge then a mid-tone brown it's sort of a tani color brown if you
can find one doesn't matter if it's a darker Brown
and we are going to do more painting later on and then we're going to hit all
the areas that would be exposed ground or mud or anything like that
so here I'm just hitting all the slopes with the Browns and around the rocks it
doesn't matter if it gets onto the rocks that's fine if you spray more heavily in
certain areas you will get a mighty look and for extra muddy look I'm actually
doing this while the PVA is still wet so on this piece and the next piece this
one the PVA is still wet so the the paint pools on top of the PVA glue quite
nicely and that gives you that wet ground muddy look to it then we're going
to go to a mid-tone green it doesn't matter if it's again slightly darker you
don't want to go too light on the green and you don't want it to be a sort of a
toxic sort of green this is a sort of natural leaf color green and you can hit
all the areas that have not yet been covered so what's great about this a lot
of people have mentioned that are you can mix water and PVA and spray it on
here to seal it problem with that is the moment water hits cardboard you're in
for all kinds of trouble so this using different colors with spray paint
actually helps to seal the sand and everything else onto the actual piece so
it's a great way to seal everything as well as get all your base colors down so
these are just the base colors and we are obviously going to paint more on top
of these to bring everything up but this is just the undercoat that helps us set
the base standard for the colors and make sure that you pay a particular
attention to the edges when you're applying the screen so the ages of the
cardboard boxes and on those little flaps because those are the things that
are going to be blended into the other boards so we want those to be as similar
as possible so you can see here even when we're going over this paint you've
still got that pooled effect some marshy wet grass look
anyone who's seen sports fields early in the morning that's what it's going to
look like so there they are at this point busy drying and we will move along
so that's under coating in the next video we're going to chat a little bit
about how to accent this with more paint and go even further on with little bits
and pieces of accoutrement as we progress in these videos anyway don't
forget to search for those secret passage videos and of course there is
the subscriber competition video might be up the side yeah it's probably up the
side until next time
